trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.

In a visual designer, when you switch to a designer view (such as `Design` view in [!INCLUDE[vs_current_short](~/includes/vs-current-short-md.md)]), the markup that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control is parsed.
A design-time version of the control is then created on the design surface.
When you switch to source view, the design-time control is persisted as markup for the Web page.
The properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner> class provide the following functionality:
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns the list of items that are used to create a smart tag panel.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.PagedControlID%2A> property is used as the designer (shadowed) version of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PagedControlID%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property returns a collection of template groups for the templated pager fields of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, which indicates that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control in order to generate the design-time markup.
The methods of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner> class provide the following functionality:

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> methods return the HTML markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> at design time.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method is used to add or remove properties from the properties grid for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner"></xref> class.

The [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] creates a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.
Gets the list of items that are used to create the smart tag panel for the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.
The list of items that are used to create the smart tag panel for the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.
Generates the HTML markup that is used to render the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control at design time.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields%2A?displayProperty=fullName> collection is not empty, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml> method refreshes the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> object to force the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method to be called and then calls its base implementation.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields%2A?displayProperty=fullName> collection is empty, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml> method invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to generate the markup.
The HTML markup that is used to render the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control at design time.
Generates the HTML markup that represents a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control at design time that has no visual representation at run time.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method is used by the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control at design time if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields%2A?displayProperty=fullName> collection is empty.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.CreatePlaceHolderDesignTimeHtml%28System.String%29> method to create a placeholder that displays the type and the ID of the control, and additional instructions for the user.
The HTML markup that represents an empty <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control at design time.
Initializes the control designer and loads the specified control.

The designer host calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.Initialize%2A> method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.Initialize%2A> method and its base methods configure properties and connect to events that are required for the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control that is associated with this designer, or a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
The control being designed.
Gets or sets a value for the designer version of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PagedControlID"></xref> property.
The value of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PagedControlID"></xref> property.
Adds or removes properties from the property grid for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method adds a new property to the property grid of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control that corresponds to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PagedControlID%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.InTemplateMode%2A> property is set to `true`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method also sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute> attribute of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to `BrowsableAttribute.No`.
This prevents pager fields from being deleted by using the `Fields` dialog box when a templated pager field is in template mode.
A collection that contains the properties that are exposed in the property grid for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control at design time.
Gets a collection of template groups for the templated pager fields of the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property creates a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> objects that represent the template elements in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control at design time.

It adds one element to the collection for each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields%2A> collection of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
A collection of template groups for the templated pager fields of the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.

Gets a value that indicates whether the designer should use a temporary copy instead of the actual <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control that is associated with the designer in order to generate the design-time markup.
`true` in all cases.
